boat.construction_details: Iroko on grown oak frames copper fastened
boat.full_description: In 1999 her owner, Simon, sailed her to the Canaries. Leaving just after the ARC 'Chloe' beat many of the modern boats across to the Caribbean. She was very successful in the Antigua Classics winning every race in her class and a second in the Concours d’Elegance competition for owner maintained boat. After this she returned to England.
boat.name: Chloe May

ownerships.note: For sale in Classic Boat, Sept 2002, no 171, £125,000 from Gosport.
ownerships.text: For sale in Classic Boat, Sept

boat.short_description: 'Chloe May' was built by Pete Nash, 1982, more or less single handed and named after his daughter.
